content.description:
Originally done as a fun v3 dyno until a certain Perry found the easier beta. 

 For the dyno, grab a smooth right-hand crimp in the seam at about chest height, and a 3 finger sloper crimp about a foot or so to the left for the other hand. Pull onto the wall with slightly awkward feet and lunge for the lip. The lip is slopey and requires a great bit of tension in order to not grate off of the crystals. Match hands and top out. 

 The easier beta requires starting with a high lefthand about a foot and a half higher than the seam used for the dyno. Start with the lefthand on a good incut gaston, pull on and bump lefthand to the lip, classic Perry.
content.location: This problem is located just left of the large tree growing in front of the East face of the boulder.

content.description: A few hard tension moves on unique angled rails lead to a fun top out on great rock. Sit start with the left hand on a large layback rail in the dihedral, and right hand down and slightly right. Find the body positioning and make a hard lock-off tension move and bring the right hand around and then left to the rail. From here continue up a few more moves before topping out some good and slopey holds.
content.location: This problem is found in the corner-like feature just rightÂ of the large tree on the East-face of the boulder.

content.description: An aesthetic arete on smooth rock. This problem has a few slightly powerful and technical moves but is over far too quickly. Sit start on the arete with some feet above the small roof. Pull on and move up the arete on some slopey holds before doing a big move over the lip to a good hold and rocking over the slab to top out.
content.location: This problem is the right-leaning left arete found on the East-face of the boulder.

content.description: An awesome problem incorporating power, balance, tension and body positioning. Sit start eight feet to the right of the left arete on an obvious smooth triangular shaped hold for the left hand and a smooth sloper down and slightly right. Pull on and move up to a crystal deposit for the right hand before figuring out how to execute the hard lock-off/ lunge for the slopey crystalline lip of the boulder. Match the sloping lip then execute a slopey and powerful mantel over a slightly exposed landing.
content.location: This line is located in the middle of the face and is easily found do the to large triangle-shaped rail feature used for the lefthand start hold.

content.description: This is a decent sized boulder with a long and astonishing East-facing wall. The Schistomatics Boulder has a variety of different rock deposits varying from smooth almost sandpaper-like to deposits of large crystals similar to that of Blair Woods. This boulder hosts a few fun problems ranging from v1 to v6, one of them being a fun, skin-grating eliminate dyno!
